lead_paragraph: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice to give Manchester United a 2-0 victory against Bolton and a 3-point lead atop the English Premier League. In another game, Robbie Keane scored the game-tying goal with two minutes left as Tottenham earned a 4-4 draw with Chelsea to stop the Blues from pulling even with second-place Arsenal.
